item.title: Lung Cancer risk increases if low Vitamin D, poor activation of Vitamin D Receptor which affects the CALB1 gene
item.description:
• Exploring the Role of Vitamin D, Vitamin D-Dependent Proteins, and Vitamin D Receptor Gene Variation in Lung Cancer Risk

Exploring the Role of Vitamin D, Vitamin D-Dependent Proteins, and Vitamin D Receptor Gene Variation in Lung Cancer Risk

Int J Mol Sci. 2024 Jun 17;25(12):6664. doi: 10.3390/ijms25126664.

Tudor Ciocarlie 1, Alexandru Cătălin Motofelea 2, Nadica Motofelea 3, Alina Gabriela Dutu 4, Alexandra Crăciun 4, Dan Costachescu 5, Ciprian Ioan Roi 6, Ciprian Nicolae Silaghi 4, Andreea Crintea 4

item.title: Glutathione and Vitamin D synergism - many studies
item.description:
1. Increased Glutathione (the master antioxidant) increases cellular and blood vitamin D

  2. Vitamin D increases Glutathione

  3. Glutathione can be increased in many ways, such as using liposomal form

One company claims their liposomal form is 64X more bioavailable

      • The Ultimate Crash Course on Glutathione! - video April 2024** YouTube, 51 minutes **3:45 Functions
      • GLUTATHIONE FOR BEGINNERS - Amazon book, Dec 2023 (free if Kindle Unlimited)** Unlocking Health And Vitality, The Comprehensive Guide To Boost Your Immunity, Detoxify Your Body, Combat Aging, And Rejuvenate Your Cells **33 pages - I have not looked at it
      • Vitamin D, Glutathione & NAC: new relationships you should know - 2022 video** YouTube, 23 minutes **—
      • Increased Vitamin D in both cells and blood when Glutathione (GSH) is increased – June 2024** The Impact of Vitamin D and L-Cysteine Co-Supplementation on Upregulating Glutathione and Vitamin D-Metabolizing Genes and in the Treatment of Circulating 25-Hydroxy Vitamin D Deficiency **Nutrients Volume 16 Issue 13 10.3390/nu16132004
      • Glutathione improved vitamin D levels and 6 Vitamin D genes (more gets to cells) (mice) - 2018** Glutathione Stimulates Vitamin D Regulatory and Glucose-Metabolism Genes, Lowers Oxidative Stress and Inflammation, and Increases 25-Hydroxy-Vitamin D Levels in Blood: A Novel Approach to Treat 25-Hydroxyvitamin D Deficiency **Antioxidants & Redox SignalingVol. 29, No. 17 https://doi.org/10.1089/ars.2017.7462
      • What are possible good ways to increase glutathione levels in the body? Asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • Review of 11 Glutathione Supplements - ConsumerLab June 2024** ConsumerLab **Price of 200 mg ranges from $0.17 cents to $2.88
      • 3 videos by Dr. Anderson on Glutathione
      • One liposomal Glutathione product was found to be 64X more bio-available than standard** Study on the bioavailability of glutathione **
      • How long does it take for liposomal glutathione to show effects (spoiler: 1 week) - asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • What supplements increase Glutathione levels in the body (NAC best?) - Asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • >50 liposomal Glutathoine products on Amazon** I chose a low-cost lipospmal form in capsules with > 400 in monthly sales **Seems good - as of Oct 2024 - I am starting on my 3rd bottle.
      • Have glutathione levels decreased recently (spolier: YES) - asked Chat-GPT 4.o June 2024
      • Glutathione, cataract and liposomal search found 4,100 items as of Oct 2024** Google Scholar__
What is glutathione - Asked Perplexity AI June 2024

Glutathione is a powerful antioxidant naturally produced in every cell of the human body.

item.title: Acupuncture of scalp activates Vitamin D genes CYP27a1, CYP27b1, and CYP24a (rats with strokes)
item.description:
• Electro-scalp acupuncture regulates the expression of CYP27a1/b1, CYP24a and related inflammatory cytokines in ischemic cortex of rats with middle cerebral artery occlusion
      • Might acupuncture regulate vitamin D genes ? Asked Perplexity AI May 2024
      • See also: The Vitamin D Receptor is activated by several Traditional Chinese Medicines – Jan 2024

Electro-scalp acupuncture regulates the expression of CYP27a1/b1, CYP24a and related inflammatory cytokines in ischemic cortex of rats with middle cerebral artery occlusion

. 2024 May 25;49(5):463-471. doi: 10.13702/j.1000-0607.20221351.

item.title: Obesity is associated with 1 to 5 poor vitamin D genes (childhood obesity in the case)
item.description:

item.title: Ischemic Stroke and Vitamin D - many studies
item.description:
Ischemic Stroke: This type of stroke occurs when a blood clot blocks or narrows an artery leading to the brain, reducing blood flow. It can be caused by thrombosis (a clot forming in the brain artery) or embolism (a clot traveling from another part of the body to the brain).

Hemorrhagic Stroke: This occurs when a blood vessel in the brain ruptures, leading to bleeding in or around the brain. It can be caused by high blood pressure, aneurysms, or arteriovenous malformations.

item.title: Obese children had less gene methylation (gene not work as well)
item.description:
• Alterations of DNA methylation profile in peripheral blood of children with simple obesity - March 2024
      • The more obese the child, the worse the Vitamin D genes: CYP27A1, CYP2R1 and CYP27B1 - March 2024
      • Vitamin D can methylate or activate many genes

Alterations of DNA methylation profile in peripheral blood of children with simple obesity - March 2024

Health Inf Sci Syst. 2024 Mar 18;12(1):26. doi: 10.1007/s13755-024-00275-w

Yi Ren # 1 2 3, Peng Huang # 1 2, Xiaoyan Huang 4, Lu Zhang 1 2, Lingjuan Liu 1 2, Wei Xiang 5 6 7, Liqun Liu 1 2, Xiaojie He 1 8

item.title: People with Multiple Sclerosis have blunted responses to Vitamin D supplementation
item.description:
• Transcriptomics identifies blunted immunomodulatory effects of vitamin D in people with multiple sclerosis
      • 9 related items in VitaminDWiki
      • Several Health problems have a blunted response to Vitamin D supplementation
      • Strange that studies have not tried activating the VDR in people with MS

Transcriptomics identifies blunted immunomodulatory effects of vitamin D in people with multiple sclerosis

Scientific Reports Vol 14, Article number: 1436 (2024) https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-024-51779-0

Wei Z. Yeh, Rodney Lea, Jim Stankovich, Sandeep Sampangi, Louise Laverick, Anneke Van der Walt, Vilija Jokubaitis, Melissa Gresle & Helmut Butzkueven
